text.id: 17. pitareken o pangtoktoan so raroa ka miketeh
text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['17. pitareken o pangtoktoan so raroa ka miketeh', '不同待遇的兩兄弟', 'Fate of two brothers', '', 'si apen Kazyaz (M, 66, Iranmilek)', '王金玉，男，66，東清村', '']

S.FORM: tao rana nokakoa am, ra-roa sira ori a mi-keteh a m-in-a-podpod jira, minanod pa sira mi-tovong do vahay a,
S.TRANSL: 以前有兩個兄弟，父母都還在
There were once two brothers. Their parents were still alive.

S.FORM: tey-ká-rilaw da nira o an-anak a anak da, o rak-rakeh am, abo do tey-ká-glaw da.
S.TRANSL: 他們非常疼愛小的，但對大的並不怎麼疼愛
They really loved the little one, but they didn’t love the older one as much.

S.FORM: ji a-pia no pi-sey-sagpian-en na o ipos na aka no avak na i-toro na do kadoan jira,
S.TRANSL: 其實，如果讓兩個孩子輪流分配到魚尾和魚的中段部份，可能比較好
Actually if they had alternated the two children’s turns on eating the fish tail and the middle of the fish, it might have been better.

S.FORM: am, to na nginanód-a do an-anak o avak na am, ori o ikay-an na jira no rak-rakeh a.
S.TRANSL: 但是他們總是把魚的中段部位分給弟弟，因此造成哥哥對父母親的不滿
They always gave the middle to the younger one, and thus the older one felt unhappy.

S.FORM: mi-ke-ian sira mi-keteh am, paka-pia-en na samsam-an o vahay da no rak-rakeh,
S.TRANSL: 他們兩兄弟在家的時候，哥哥就特別的打掃家裡
When the two brothers stayed at home, the older one straightened the house up.

S.FORM: teyka na samsam-an am, ma-no-notong rana so kan-en da,
S.TRANSL: 他打掃完了以後又煮飯
After he finished straightening, he started to cook.

S.FORM: teyka ma-ngara-ngaraw am, manmama rana.
S.TRANSL: 飯熟了以後將未燒完的木柴移開，然後開始嚼檳榔
After he finished cooking, he moved away the log and started to chew betel nut.

W.TRANSL: 主焦-疊-移開未燒完的木柴

S.FORM: manmama rana ori am, o eraed am, mimin-en na rengy-an a,
S.TRANSL: 然後將家園的每一塊石頭上吐檳榔汁（渣）
When he chewed betel nut, he spit on every rock there.

S.FORM: i-pa-cita na so niapoan na, a y-ap-apaw na sira.
S.TRANSL: 這是為了留給父母親看的；也是表示思念父母親之意
This was for the parents to see that he missed them.

S.FORM: ma-teyka na rana a rengy-an am, ma-níring do an-anak am,
S.TRANSL: 吐完了檳榔汁（渣）以後，對弟弟說
After spitting betel nut juice, the older one said to the younger one,

S.FORM: “imo rana, mo keypong am, to ka ngian do vahay ta, ta ma-ngay ko do takey an,
S.TRANSL: 親愛的，你呢，就待在家裡，因為我要上山去
“My dear, I will go into the mountains, and you just wait at home.

S.FORM: imo rana am, si koan mo sira ina ta am, si m-oli sira am, “wanjin si kaka mo”,
S.TRANSL: 如果爸媽回來，問說“你哥哥呢？” 的時候，你就說，
When our parents come home and ask, ‘Where is your older brother?’ then you say,

S.FORM: “si Kaka rana am, ya na inio ikay-an ni Kaka am, ya ni-ma-ngay do takey, ori vazay na, ori vazay na ni Kaka”,
S.TRANSL: “哥哥因為對你們不滿，所以他上山去了。哥哥他如何如何 ”
“Big brother was not happy with you, so he went into the mountains. He was saying this and that ”

S.FORM: “ta nio ji mang-to-kto-i si Kaka, am ori na ikay-an jinio” koan mo an.
S.TRANSL: “因為你們從不關心哥哥，所以他對你們非常的不滿” 你就這麼說
You showed no concern for the older one, so he was very unhappy with you.”

S.FORM: ji a-ni-ma-koan sang o an-anak; ta tey-ká-glaw na o an-anak no rak-rakeh am, ori ji na maka-kto-i so ka-taid na do vahay da.
S.TRANSL: 可是弟弟並沒有依哥哥的話做。由於年長的平時很疼愛弟弟，所以弟弟捨不得他，不想留在家裡
The younger one didn’t do as the older one asked. The older one loved the younger one very much, so the younger one would miss him and didn’t want to stay home.

S.FORM: karaan am, to lávi ori am, to na rana rára do takey o an-anak a, ka-to da rana nibó-an a.
S.TRANSL: 後來弟弟就一直哭，哥哥只好帶著他一起上山去了
The younger one kept crying, so the older one had to take him along.

S.FORM: s-om-ivoz sira do k-ahas-an am, mang-otas so raon a ka-ptad na nia, ika-doa na no raon am kotas-en na ka-ptad na nia.
S.TRANSL: 他們到了山裡，就採姑婆芋葉；他採到葉子後就擱在原採葉處，他採到第二片葉子時也擱在原採葉處
When they got into the deep forest, they started to pick wild taro leaves, and each time he would leave it in the same place, and he did the same thing over and over.

S.FORM: ma-níring o an-anak ori am, “mo kongo-en, mo Kaka, o raon a pika-tai-taid-en?”
S.TRANSL: 弟弟說“哥哥，為什麼你每採一片姑婆芋葉就擱放在原採處？”
“Big brother, why do you always pick one wild taro leaf and leave it there?” the younger one said.

S.FORM: “oya rana am, singkad-an mo ya an, ta no si m-oli ta am, ka-to mo nopós-an do jia a cita-en an”.
S.TRANSL: 這個啊，你要看清楚哦，因為待會兒我們回家時，你就看（依循）這些（葉子）回家去
“You have to look at these clearly. When it’s time to go home, you can follow the leaves.”

S.FORM: karaan am, ka-to na pi-inét-an sia pang-otas-an so raon a, ka-ptad na nia do pang-onong-an da.
S.TRANSL: 就這樣，他一路採葉子，同時也把葉子擱在採過葉子的路上
He left the leaves on the path as they went past.

S.FORM: maka-ranes rana sira do angay-an na no rak-rakeh am,
S.TRANSL: 一直到了哥哥想要（進）去的地方時
They went on until they reached the place the older one wanted to be.

S.FORM: ka-to na vezéd-an do dang a, ala mina to mi-váwa o rako a azcip am, ori mi na ni-sdep-an rana.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟就留在那裡等候。可能一個大洞穴忽然開了吧，哥哥就進入了那裡
The younger one stayed there. There probably was a cave. The cave opened, and the older one went in.

S.FORM: i-k-ówtok na no an-anak am, “ya pa ji mi-s-in-aoli si Kaka ori” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: 後來弟弟等得不耐煩了，就想“哥哥怎麼還不回來？”
The younger one was impatient, and thought, “Why hasn’t the big brother come back?”

S.FORM: ma-ngay am ásio o tao-tao, ásio o apzo-pzot na do ni-angay-an na?
S.TRANSL: 於是就去找人，可是哪有人？連人走過的痕跡都沒有
He went to look, but he couldn’t find him. There wasn’t any trace of where he went.

S.FORM: karaan am, mi-da-dowdaw rana ori a om-lavi a.
S.TRANSL: 於是，弟弟就很傷心的哭了
The younger one was very sad and cried.

S.FORM: a to na a-kála o ni-ma-ngay rana do tey-rahem, m-oli rana ori a.
S.TRANSL: 人都已進入了地下，怎麼可能找得到？他只好回家去了
How can he find someone that has entered the ground? He could only go home.

S.FORM: ji ko na ngon-onong-i ori a.
S.TRANSL: 關於那個人（弟弟）的情形，我就不再詳說了
[As for the younger brother, I will say no more.

S.FORM: tao rana ni-ma-ngay do tey-rahem ori am, maka-ranes rana ori do tey-rahem am, to na nita o mi-moro-morong a ni-ma-karang na tagakal ori,
S.TRANSL: 至於進入地下的那個人，他到了地下以後，就注意到一家很高的涼台，屋頂上還插著羽飾
The person who went underground saw a very tall porch with some feather ornaments on the roof.

S.FORM: ta vahay da nira ori am avak no ili, ori mi na ni-sdep-an a, ka-pi-to-toong na no piayo do tomok da, karaan am, ka-to na a-kman-an so sang a.
S.TRANSL: 那家正好是村子的中央，他就選了那家並進入屋內。然後拿了一個竹篩到中柱去把自己蓋起來。就這樣子
The house was in the middle of the village. He went in, found a sifter made of bamboo, and hid himself behind a pillar. He was just like that.

S.FORM: ala pi-yowli-in rana am, mi-kala-kala o mavakes na no pa-nir-siring-en da ori so,
S.TRANSL: 大概是下午收工返家的時間吧。該家的女主人，也是村長的夫人不知道在尋找什麼 的時候
At about the time work ended, the woman of the house, who was the wife of the village chief, was looking for

S.FORM: ikong pala kala-en na do tomok da am, to na i vawa-a o piayo am, am-ian so tao am, “ey, logaw” koan na am, to ngíso a.
S.TRANSL: 不知道她去中柱找什麼東西？後來就掀開了那竹篩，結果發現裡面有人，嚇得她退了一步，“哎喲，有人！”
I don’t know what she was looking for at the pillar. When she pulled up the sifter and saw a person underneath, she was so frightened that she back pedaled, saying, “Oh, there is someone here!”

S.FORM: ma-níring o tao am, “yaken rana ya am, ori o vazay ko a, ko ni-ikay-an sira ama, ori o ka-koan ko do jia”.
S.TRANSL: 那人說“我呢，事情是這樣的，我是因為對父母親不滿，所以才來到這裡的”
“I have blah, blah, blah I came here because my parents weren’t fair. ”

S.FORM: “cí-ngoan-eri” koan na am, i-panta na rana so ayo-ayob na, ta abo ayob da do tey-ngato ya a.
S.TRANSL: “原來是這樣啊” ，後來女主人就去拿衣服給他。因為這地上的人當時還沒有衣服
“Oh, so that’s what happened.” She got clothes for him, for the people on earth didn’t have clothing back then.

S.FORM: ala mehakay o tao do tey-ngato ya, o mavakes am tao do tey-rahem a.
S.TRANSL: 上面來的可能是男的，而地下的人才是女的
The person from above was actually a man, and the person from below was a woman.

S.FORM: m-ównay rana am, am-ian rana so taodtod da nira ori a,
S.TRANSL: 後來他們有了孩子
After a while, they had children.

S.FORM: no mi-walam sira do tagakal am, to maka-cita so s-om-ibo no zaig na asa ka tao a.
S.TRANSL: 每當他們在涼台上休息時，他若看見有人帶著他的斧頭上山去
Whenever they were resting on the porch, if he saw a person going into the mountains with an ax,

S.FORM: ma-níring do iciaroa na am, “ásio ito, mo Ama, a ya mi-zaig a, ya ma-ngay do wajin ito?”,
S.TRANSL: 他就問岳父說“爸，那個人帶著斧頭要去哪裡？”
he would ask his father-in-law, “Dad, where is that person going with an ax?”

S.FORM: “iya rana ori, manga anak ko am, ya ma-nengeh ori so tatala na ori”,
S.TRANSL: “他啊，他是要去砍他的船（船板）”
“He is going to cut wood for a boat.”

S.FORM: “a ikongo tatala?” “to mo na a-cita si ma-maog, manga anak ko am”.
S.TRANSL: “什麼是船？” “你等他造好了你就知道了，親愛的孩子”
“What is a boat?” “You will know after it is finished.”

S.FORM: ipi-sa so ka-pi-walam da am, to da a-cita o ra-roa s-om-ibo no zaig da,
S.TRANSL: 又一次，他們休息聊天，他們又看見兩個人帶著斧頭一起上山去
Once again, while they were resting and chatting, they saw two people with axes going into the mountains.

S.FORM: “ásio sira ito, mo Ama, ya ra-roa ya s-om-ibo no zaig da ito?”
S.TRANSL: “爸，他們兩個人帶著斧頭上山去做什麼？”
“Dad, what are the two of them going into the mountains with axes for?”

S.FORM: “sira rana ori am, sia mi-kavang ori, manga anak ko, sia ma-mareng so pi-kavang-an”
S.TRANSL: “他們啊，他們是二人船的組員，要做雙人船的”
“The two of them are the crew of a two-person boat. They are making a two-person boat.”

S.FORM: ipi-sa so ka-paka-cita da am, na-nem sira ori a,
S.TRANSL: 某天，他們又看見六個人一起上山去
Another day, they saw six people walk up the mountains.

S.FORM: “sia ma-ngay do wanjin o ya aro a ya na-nem ito, mo Ama, sia mi man-ngo ito?”
S.TRANSL: “爸爸，他們六個人一起要去哪裡？做什麼？”
“Dad, where are those six going? What are they doing?”

S.FORM: “sira rana ori am, da i-sibo o cinedkeran da nira ori a, ya tlo sira ori a, alikey a cinedkeran ori.
S.TRANSL: “他們啊，是為他們的大船而上山，他們要做的是三對槳的大船，算是小型的大船”
“They are going to make a big boat. They will make a boat with three sets of oars. It is a small big boat.”

S.FORM: akman sang, ta to da lo-lolo-a, to sira nibo o wa-wao a ori am,
S.TRANSL: 如同前述的情形一樣，又看見八個人成一路隊形的上山去
Just as before, they saw eight people in a row going into the mountains.

S.FORM: “ásio rana sira ito, mo Ama, a sia ma-ngay do wanjin sira ito?”,
S.TRANSL: “爸爸，你看他們這麼多人，他們要去哪裡啊？”
“Dad, why are they going together (with so many people)? Where are they going?”

S.FORM: “sia mi-ci-cinedkeran sira ori”, “ning”.
S.TRANSL: “他們是要準備做大船的” ，“哦” 。
“They are preparing to make a big boat.” “Oh.”

S.FORM: “sia ma-mareng sira ori so cinedkeran da, sia mi-vazay ori, ya asa ngarnan o avat na no nang am, ori da i-ka-sa ngarnan”.
S.TRANSL: “他們是要造大船，造好了船要舉行完工落成禮的儀式。那艘船有十支槳及十個船員”
“They are going to make a big boat. After it is built, there will be a ceremony to celebrate its completion. There will be ten oars, and so there must be ten people.

S.FORM: “a ya akman so wanjin o ka-ma-magen-an na? ya akman so wanjin na ka-parng-an no nang a”, “to mo na a-cita am”.
S.TRANSL: “它到底長什麼樣子？製造的過程又如何？” “你就慢慢的看吧”
“What does it look like? What is the process of making the boat?” “Just watch.”

S.FORM: “k-om-avos ori am, pi-vazay-an da ori a, ka-pa-nodah da so viniay a, ka-pa-toyon da, a ka-tenng-an pa o,
S.TRANSL: “他們造好了船以後，就會舉行落成禮儀式；然後殺豬，邀請親朋好友共享，反正 ，怎麼說呢
After they finish the boat, they will have a ceremony to celebrate its completion. They will kill pigs, ask their friends and family over, and I don’t know how to describe it.

S.FORM: akma saon sira man-’agnat saon am, ka-pang-hap da so soli.
S.TRANSL: 當然還有拋船儀式，採挖芋頭等等
Of course, there will be boat lifting and taro digging in this ceremony.

S.FORM: ásio, am-ian so ni-ang-angáy-an do tey-ngato ya.
S.TRANSL: 反觀地上的人，有什麼？
Compared to the people above, they were much more sophisticated.

S.FORM: m-ownay rana am, ma-níring rana o tao do tey-ngato ya ori am, “ko na tey-ká-paw sira ama ta do tey-ngato a,.”
S.TRANSL: 過了很久以後，上面來的人說“我實在非常想念上面的爸爸媽媽， ”
After a long time, the man from above said, “I miss my parents from up there ”

S.FORM: nona, to ngían so mi-saza, “ásio ori, ikong ori” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: 哦，對了，後來又有人蓋工作房，他又問“那是什麼啊？”
Oh, yeah, someone was building a workhouse. He asked, “What is that?”

S.FORM: “sia mi-saza” koan da am, “akma sang a ma-pa-toyon a”,
S.TRANSL: 他們說，“他們是在蓋工作房” ，“他們也會邀請客人（來分享他們的成果）”
“They are building a workhouse. They will ask people over to share it (their achievement) with them.”

S.FORM: to ngían so mi-vahay am, akma so sang, ji rana a-teneng a, to na rana a-lák-an sira no tao do tey-ngato a.
S.TRANSL: 後來又有人蓋房子，如同前述情形一樣。對於他看見的每一件事情，還有他的好奇，已經不知道怎麼來形容了
He saw someone building a house and asked the same thing. Everything made him curious. I don’t know how to describe (his curiosity) anymore.

S.FORM: karaan am, mang-hap sira so asa ka pinareng ka-ngay da rana do tey-ngato, ma-níring do mavakes na am, “to ka pa ngían jia an” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 後來他們殺了一隻羊當禮物帶上去。他對他太太說“你先待在這裡”
Afterwards they killed a goat as a gift to take up. “Wait here for a second,” he asked his wife.

S.FORM: am mi na i-panta sira so ayo-ayob da do tey-ngato ori, a ni-ni-a-hap da do tey-rahem a, ka-pi-’eza da rana ma-ngay.
S.TRANSL: 他就先把從地下帶來的衣服拿上去給他的父母親穿上。然後他們夫妻倆才一起回家去
He took some clothing up for his parents to wear. Then the two of them went to see his parents together.

S.FORM: karaan am, on-onong-an da rana o ka-sa-saod-an da do tey-rahem am, ji sira rana a-teneng a mi-zi-ziak kono o tao do tey-ngato ya.
S.TRANSL: 後來他就詳述地下的種種文化和習俗，聽得上面人都不知該說什麼好
After a detailed description of what happened beneath of all the traditions and culture, the people above were speechless.

S.FORM: ori rana o ka-va-vatanen da nokakoa, do ni-m-ikay do niapoan da ang.
S.TRANSL: 關於不滿父母親的故事，就講到這裡
This is the story of the person who was unhappy with his parents. This is all I want to say.

S.FORM: no mi-sagpian sira so yakan am, inana ipo-ipos na o i-pa-sagpian na so rak-rakeh a.
S.TRANSL: 每當他們分配菜的時候，他們總是將魚尾巴分配給哥哥
Every time they split the dishes, they always gave the fish tail to the older one.

S.FORM: ipi-sa so k-angay da do takey no niapoan da am, mi-ke-ian sira mi-keteh.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，他們的父母親上山去了。他們兩兄弟待在家裡作伴
One day, the parents went into the mountains. Only the two children were home.

S.FORM: ma-níring o rak-rakeh am, “to ka ngían jia, mo koa, ta mi ko pa do ka-sibo-an an, si-toai na am m-ai ko an”,
S.TRANSL: 哥哥說“你呢，待在這裡，我去大便一下，我一會兒就回來”
“You wait here. I want to relieve myself, and I’ll be back soon”, the older one said.

S.FORM: “ásio ka ya ang” koan na o tao a ori a,
S.TRANSL: 她對那人說“你怎麼會在這裡？”
“Why are you here?” she asked.

S.FORM: karaan am, am-ian so anak na, asa o anak na no tao do tey-rahem a mehakay am, to na rana i neksék-i no nang a.
S.TRANSL: 後來地下那一家人有一個兒子，她就嫁給了他
The man underground had a son. The woman from above was married to him.

S.FORM: ma-nowji rana ori am, asa ngarnan o s-om-ibo, “ásio ya tey-áro ito, mo Ama”,
S.TRANSL: 最後看到的是十個人一起上山的情形，“爸爸，你看，怎麼那麼多人啊？”
The last time they saw ten people going into the mountains. “Dad, why are there so many people going into the mountains at once?”

S.FORM: ka-to na a-lák-an no pi-mi-masaod-an da do tey-rahem ori a, “ori o ha-ha-ha-hap-an da sia ya”,
S.TRANSL: 對於地下世界的各種習俗活動，讓他好奇不已，“哦，原來他們是這麼做的！”
He was very awed by the things that the people beneath the ground did and their different ceremonies and traditions. “Oh, so that is how it was done!”

S.FORM: mik-ownáy-an rana am, “ya ko rana tey-ká-paw sira ama ta do tey-ngato a, sira ke-hakay mo a, ma-ngay namen pa jira, ta namen tey-ká-paw-an sira an”, “a inio saon am”.
S.TRANSL: 很久以後，他說“我實在是太想念上面的爸爸媽媽了，（對岳父母說）你們的親家，我們可否上去一趟看看他們” ，“隨你們啊”
After a long time, he said, “I really miss my parents from up top. I really want to go back up for a while to see them.” “As you wish.”

S.FORM: am ori rana n-inara da rana mi-ci-cinedkeran am mi-vahay am, mi-saza am, mi-ta-tagakal am, ikong ji da ni-vi-vood jira do tao do tey-rahem.
S.TRANSL: 從此，上面的人開始造船、蓋房子、蓋工作房、蓋涼台等等，他們所有的做法哪一樣不是從地下世界學習的呢
That is when the people above started building boats, houses, workhouses, and porches. Not one thing [we have was not taken from the people below.
